newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Costello says no wage level danger in GDP.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Costello says no wage level danger in GDP.

text.p: Australian Treasurer Peter Costello said on Wednesday that March quarter economic growth data did not show that wages had risen into a danger zone for policy makers.
Costello told reporters the wages figures in the national accounts released on Wednesday were consistent with other recent wages data.
"What they show is that movements in wages are probably overall a little above four percent," he said.
"But I don't read from them that we've crossed into the particular danger zone yet," he said.

The Reserve Bank, which aims to keep underlying inflation between two and three percent over the course of an economic cycle, has said it would be concerned if annual wages growth exceeded 4.5 percent, a level at which economists expect it to act by raising interest rates.

Citing the growth and inflation outlook, the central bank surprised financial markets and the business community on May 23 when it cut the official cash rate by 50 basis points to 5.5 percent on May 23, the fourth cut since mid-1996.
